name: 中國經學名著選讀
goals: Students will read and interpret Western scholars’ translation works and research papers to have a more comprehensive understanding of their interpretations and evaluations of the texts of the Chinese Classics.

Students are encourged to discuss and compare the debates about various approaches to the text comprehension of the Chinese Classics and analyze their diversity and applications in cross-cultural perspectives in studies of the influential scholars of the West and the East.

Students will present to and exchange with their classmates in English about their ideas, concepts and information pertaining to the assigned readings and their reflections on the study of the Chinese Classics in the West in order to develop English communication skills and formulate statements of their own opinions.

methodologies.note:
Research study
Students with the guidance of the teacher are required to choose a research topic relating to the course content and write a research paper.

grading.note: 期中口頭報告：Oral presentation: A 10-minute oral class presentation with PowerPoint slides

期末書面報告：Term paper: A research paper including the cover page, contents page, introduction, main text/body, conclusion and references with full documentation - for the undergraduates: 3-4 pages
for the graduates: 7-8 pages
閱讀書面心得：Assignments: Including 5 reading reports, 1-2 video-reviewing reports - Each written assignment is 2 pages in length for the undergraduates, and 4 pages in length for the graduates
